11#ifndef P2P_BASE_CONNECTION_H_
12#define P2P_BASE_CONNECTION_H_
13
14#include <memory>
15#include <string>
16#include <vector>
17
18#include "absl/types/optional.h"
19#include "api/candidate.h"
20#include "api/transport/stun.h"
21#include "logging/rtc_event_log/ice_logger.h"
22#include "p2p/base/candidate_pair_interface.h"
23#include "p2p/base/connection_info.h"
24#include "p2p/base/p2p_transport_channel_ice_field_trials.h"
25#include "p2p/base/stun_request.h"
26#include "p2p/base/transport_description.h"
27#include "rtc_base/async_packet_socket.h"
28#include "rtc_base/message_handler.h"
29#include "rtc_base/network.h"
30#include "rtc_base/numerics/event_based_exponential_moving_average.h"
31#include "rtc_base/rate_tracker.h"
32
33namespace cricket {
34
35// Version number for GOOG_PING, this is added to have the option of
36// adding other flavors in the future.
37constexpr int kGoogPingVersion = 1;
38
39// Connection and Port has circular dependencies.
40// So we use forward declaration rather than include.
41class Port;
42
43// Forward declaration so that a ConnectionRequest can contain a Connection.
44class Connection;
45
46struct CandidatePair final : public CandidatePairInterface {
47 ~CandidatePair() override = default;
48
49 const Candidate& local_candidate() const override { return local; }
50 const Candidate& remote_candidate() const override { return remote; }
51
52 Candidate local;
53 Candidate remote;
54};
55
56// A ConnectionRequest is a simple STUN ping used to determine writability.
57class ConnectionRequest : public StunRequest {
58 public:
59 explicit ConnectionRequest(Connection* connection);
60 void Prepare(StunMessage* request) override;
61 void OnResponse(StunMessage* response) override;
62 void OnErrorResponse(StunMessage* response) override;
63 void OnTimeout() override;
64 void OnSent() override;
65 int resend_delay() override;
66
67 private:
68 Connection* const connection_;
69};
70
71// Represents a communication link between a port on the local client and a
72// port on the remote client.
73class Connection : public CandidatePairInterface,
74 public rtc::MessageHandlerAutoCleanup,
75 public sigslot::has_slots<> {
76 public:
77 struct SentPing {
78 SentPing(const std::string id, int64_t sent_time, uint32_t nomination)
79 : id(id), sent_time(sent_time), nomination(nomination) {}
80
81 std::string id;
82 int64_t sent_time;
83 uint32_t nomination;
84 };
85
86 ~Connection() override;
87
88 // A unique ID assigned when the connection is created.
89 uint32_t id() const { return id_; }
90
91 // Implementation of virtual methods in CandidatePairInterface.
92 // Returns the description of the local port
93 const Candidate& local_candidate() const override;
94 // Returns the description of the remote port to which we communicate.
95 const Candidate& remote_candidate() const override;
96
97 // Return local network for this connection.
98 virtual const rtc::Network* network() const;
99 // Return generation for this connection.
100 virtual int generation() const;
101
102 // Returns the pair priority.
103 virtual uint64_t priority() const;
104
105 enum WriteState {
106 STATE_WRITABLE = 0, // we have received ping responses recently
107 STATE_WRITE_UNRELIABLE = 1, // we have had a few ping failures
108 STATE_WRITE_INIT = 2, // we have yet to receive a ping response
109 STATE_WRITE_TIMEOUT = 3, // we have had a large number of ping failures
110 };
111
112 WriteState write_state() const { return write_state_; }
113 bool writable() const { return write_state_ == STATE_WRITABLE; }
114 bool receiving() const { return receiving_; }
115
116 // Determines whether the connection has finished connecting. This can only
117 // be false for TCP connections.
118 bool connected() const { return connected_; }
119 bool weak() const { return !(writable() && receiving() && connected()); }
120 bool active() const { return write_state_ != STATE_WRITE_TIMEOUT; }
121
122 // A connection is dead if it can be safely deleted.
123 bool dead(int64_t now) const;
124
125 // Estimate of the round-trip time over this connection.
126 int rtt() const { return rtt_; }
127
128 int unwritable_timeout() const;
129 void set_unwritable_timeout(const absl::optional<int>& value_ms) {
130 unwritable_timeout_ = value_ms;
131 }
132 int unwritable_min_checks() const;
133 void set_unwritable_min_checks(const absl::optional<int>& value) {
134 unwritable_min_checks_ = value;
135 }
136 int inactive_timeout() const;
137 void set_inactive_timeout(const absl::optional<int>& value) {
138 inactive_timeout_ = value;
139 }
140
141 // Gets the |ConnectionInfo| stats, where |best_connection| has not been
142 // populated (default value false).
143 ConnectionInfo stats();
144
145 sigslot::signal1<Connection*> SignalStateChange;
146
147 // Sent when the connection has decided that it is no longer of value. It
148 // will delete itself immediately after this call.
149 sigslot::signal1<Connection*> SignalDestroyed;
150
151 // The connection can send and receive packets asynchronously. This matches
152 // the interface of AsyncPacketSocket, which may use UDP or TCP under the
153 // covers.
154 virtual int Send(const void* data,
155 size_t size,
156 const rtc::PacketOptions& options) = 0;
157
158 // Error if Send() returns < 0
159 virtual int GetError() = 0;
160
161 sigslot::signal4<Connection*, const char*, size_t, int64_t> SignalReadPacket;
162
163 sigslot::signal1<Connection*> SignalReadyToSend;
164
165 // Called when a packet is received on this connection.
166 void OnReadPacket(const char* data, size_t size, int64_t packet_time_us);
167
168 // Called when the socket is currently able to send.
169 void OnReadyToSend();
170
171 // Called when a connection is determined to be no longer useful to us. We
172 // still keep it around in case the other side wants to use it. But we can
173 // safely stop pinging on it and we can allow it to time out if the other
174 // side stops using it as well.
175 bool pruned() const { return pruned_; }
176 void Prune();
177
178 bool use_candidate_attr() const { return use_candidate_attr_; }
179 void set_use_candidate_attr(bool enable);
180
181 void set_nomination(uint32_t value) { nomination_ = value; }
182
183 uint32_t remote_nomination() const { return remote_nomination_; }
184 // One or several pairs may be nominated based on if Regular or Aggressive
185 // Nomination is used. https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5245#section-8
186 // |nominated| is defined both for the controlling or controlled agent based
187 // on if a nomination has been pinged or acknowledged. The controlled agent
188 // gets its |remote_nomination_| set when pinged by the controlling agent with
189 // a nomination value. The controlling agent gets its |acked_nomination_| set
190 // when receiving a response to a nominating ping.
191 bool nominated() const { return acked_nomination_ || remote_nomination_; }
192 void set_remote_ice_mode(IceMode mode) { remote_ice_mode_ = mode; }
193
194 int receiving_timeout() const;
195 void set_receiving_timeout(absl::optional<int> receiving_timeout_ms) {
196 receiving_timeout_ = receiving_timeout_ms;
197 }
198
199 // Makes the connection go away.
200 void Destroy();
201
202 // Makes the connection go away, in a failed state.
203 void FailAndDestroy();
204
205 // Prunes the connection and sets its state to STATE_FAILED,
206 // It will not be used or send pings although it can still receive packets.
207 void FailAndPrune();
208
209 // Checks that the state of this connection is up-to-date. The argument is
210 // the current time, which is compared against various timeouts.
211 void UpdateState(int64_t now);
212
213 // Called when this connection should try checking writability again.
214 int64_t last_ping_sent() const { return last_ping_sent_; }
215 void Ping(int64_t now);
216 void ReceivedPingResponse(
217 int rtt,
218 const std::string& request_id,
219 const absl::optional<uint32_t>& nomination = absl::nullopt);
220 int64_t last_ping_response_received() const {
221 return last_ping_response_received_;
222 }
223 const absl::optional<std::string>& last_ping_id_received() const {
224 return last_ping_id_received_;
225 }
226 // Used to check if any STUN ping response has been received.
227 int rtt_samples() const { return rtt_samples_; }
228
229 // Called whenever a valid ping is received on this connection. This is
230 // public because the connection intercepts the first ping for us.
231 int64_t last_ping_received() const { return last_ping_received_; }
232 void ReceivedPing(
233 const absl::optional<std::string>& request_id = absl::nullopt);
234 // Handles the binding request; sends a response if this is a valid request.
235 void HandleStunBindingOrGoogPingRequest(IceMessage* msg);
236 // Handles the piggyback acknowledgement of the lastest connectivity check
237 // that the remote peer has received, if it is indicated in the incoming
238 // connectivity check from the peer.
239 void HandlePiggybackCheckAcknowledgementIfAny(StunMessage* msg);
240 // Timestamp when data was last sent (or attempted to be sent).
241 int64_t last_send_data() const { return last_send_data_; }
242 int64_t last_data_received() const { return last_data_received_; }
243
244 // Debugging description of this connection
245 std::string ToDebugId() const;
246 std::string ToString() const;
247 std::string ToSensitiveString() const;
248 // Structured description of this candidate pair.
249 const webrtc::IceCandidatePairDescription& ToLogDescription();
250 void set_ice_event_log(webrtc::IceEventLog* ice_event_log) {
251 ice_event_log_ = ice_event_log;
252 }
253 // Prints pings_since_last_response_ into a string.
254 void PrintPingsSinceLastResponse(std::string* pings, size_t max);
255
256 bool reported() const { return reported_; }
257 void set_reported(bool reported) { reported_ = reported; }
258 // The following two methods are only used for logging in ToString above, and
259 // this flag is set true by P2PTransportChannel for its selected candidate
260 // pair.
261 bool selected() const { return selected_; }
262 void set_selected(bool selected) { selected_ = selected; }
263
264 // This signal will be fired if this connection is nominated by the
265 // controlling side.
266 sigslot::signal1<Connection*> SignalNominated;
267
268 // Invoked when Connection receives STUN error response with 487 code.
269 void HandleRoleConflictFromPeer();
270
271 IceCandidatePairState state() const { return state_; }
272
273 int num_pings_sent() const { return num_pings_sent_; }
274
275 IceMode remote_ice_mode() const { return remote_ice_mode_; }
276
277 uint32_t ComputeNetworkCost() const;
278
279 // Update the ICE password and/or generation of the remote candidate if the
280 // ufrag in |params| matches the candidate's ufrag, and the
281 // candidate's password and/or ufrag has not been set.
282 void MaybeSetRemoteIceParametersAndGeneration(const IceParameters& params,
283 int generation);
284
285 // If |remote_candidate_| is peer reflexive and is equivalent to
286 // |new_candidate| except the type, update |remote_candidate_| to
287 // |new_candidate|.
288 void MaybeUpdatePeerReflexiveCandidate(const Candidate& new_candidate);
289
290 // Returns the last received time of any data, stun request, or stun
291 // response in milliseconds
292 int64_t last_received() const;
293 // Returns the last time when the connection changed its receiving state.
294 int64_t receiving_unchanged_since() const {
295 return receiving_unchanged_since_;
296 }
297
298 bool stable(int64_t now) const;
299
300 // Check if we sent |val| pings without receving a response.
301 bool TooManyOutstandingPings(const absl::optional<int>& val) const;
302
303 void SetIceFieldTrials(const IceFieldTrials* field_trials);
304 const rtc::EventBasedExponentialMovingAverage& GetRttEstimate() const {
305 return rtt_estimate_;
306 }
307
308 // Reset the connection to a state of a newly connected.
309 // - STATE_WRITE_INIT
310 // - receving = false
311 // - throw away all pending request
312 // - reset RttEstimate
313 //
314 // Keep the following unchanged:
315 // - connected
316 // - remote_candidate
317 // - statistics
318 //
319 // Does not trigger SignalStateChange
320 void ForgetLearnedState();
321
322 void SendStunBindingResponse(const StunMessage* request);
323 void SendGoogPingResponse(const StunMessage* request);
324 void SendResponseMessage(const StunMessage& response);
325
326 // An accessor for unit tests.
327 Port* PortForTest() { return port_; }
328 const Port* PortForTest() const { return port_; }
329
330 // Public for unit tests.
331 uint32_t acked_nomination() const { return acked_nomination_; }
332
333 // Public for unit tests.
334 void set_remote_nomination(uint32_t remote_nomination) {
335 remote_nomination_ = remote_nomination;
336 }
337
338 protected:
339 enum { MSG_DELETE = 0, MSG_FIRST_AVAILABLE };
340
341 // Constructs a new connection to the given remote port.
342 Connection(Port* port, size_t index, const Candidate& candidate);
343
344 // Called back when StunRequestManager has a stun packet to send
345 void OnSendStunPacket(const void* data, size_t size, StunRequest* req);
346
347 // Callbacks from ConnectionRequest
348 virtual void OnConnectionRequestResponse(ConnectionRequest* req,
349 StunMessage* response);
350 void OnConnectionRequestErrorResponse(ConnectionRequest* req,
351 StunMessage* response);
352 void OnConnectionRequestTimeout(ConnectionRequest* req);
353 void OnConnectionRequestSent(ConnectionRequest* req);
354
355 bool rtt_converged() const;
356
357 // If the response is not received within 2 * RTT, the response is assumed to
358 // be missing.
359 bool missing_responses(int64_t now) const;
360
361 // Changes the state and signals if necessary.
362 void set_write_state(WriteState value);
363 void UpdateReceiving(int64_t now);
364 void set_state(IceCandidatePairState state);
365 void set_connected(bool value);
366
367 uint32_t nomination() const { return nomination_; }
368
369 void OnMessage(rtc::Message* pmsg) override;
370
371 // The local port where this connection sends and receives packets.
372 Port* port() { return port_; }
373 const Port* port() const { return port_; }
374
375 uint32_t id_;
376 Port* port_;
377 size_t local_candidate_index_;
378 Candidate remote_candidate_;
379
380 ConnectionInfo stats_;
381 rtc::RateTracker recv_rate_tracker_;
382 rtc::RateTracker send_rate_tracker_;
383 int64_t last_send_data_ = 0;
384
385 private:
386 // Update the local candidate based on the mapped address attribute.
387 // If the local candidate changed, fires SignalStateChange.
388 void MaybeUpdateLocalCandidate(ConnectionRequest* request,
389 StunMessage* response);
390
391 void LogCandidatePairConfig(webrtc::IceCandidatePairConfigType type);
392 void LogCandidatePairEvent(webrtc::IceCandidatePairEventType type,
393 uint32_t transaction_id);
394
395 // Check if this IceMessage is identical
396 // to last message ack:ed STUN_BINDING_REQUEST.
397 bool ShouldSendGoogPing(const StunMessage* message);
398
399 WriteState write_state_;
400 bool receiving_;
401 bool connected_;
402 bool pruned_;
403 bool selected_ = false;
404 // By default |use_candidate_attr_| flag will be true,
405 // as we will be using aggressive nomination.
406 // But when peer is ice-lite, this flag "must" be initialized to false and
407 // turn on when connection becomes "best connection".
408 bool use_candidate_attr_;
409 // Used by the controlling side to indicate that this connection will be
410 // selected for transmission if the peer supports ICE-renomination when this
411 // value is positive. A larger-value indicates that a connection is nominated
412 // later and should be selected by the controlled side with higher precedence.
413 // A zero-value indicates not nominating this connection.
414 uint32_t nomination_ = 0;
415 // The last nomination that has been acknowledged.
416 uint32_t acked_nomination_ = 0;
417 // Used by the controlled side to remember the nomination value received from
418 // the controlling side. When the peer does not support ICE re-nomination, its
419 // value will be 1 if the connection has been nominated.
420 uint32_t remote_nomination_ = 0;
421
422 IceMode remote_ice_mode_;
423 StunRequestManager requests_;
424 int rtt_;
425 int rtt_samples_ = 0;
426 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcicecandidatepairstats-totalroundtriptime
427 uint64_t total_round_trip_time_ms_ = 0;
428 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcicecandidatepairstats-currentroundtriptime
429 absl::optional<uint32_t> current_round_trip_time_ms_;
430 int64_t last_ping_sent_; // last time we sent a ping to the other side
431 int64_t last_ping_received_; // last time we received a ping from the other
432 // side
433 int64_t last_data_received_;
434 int64_t last_ping_response_received_;
435 int64_t receiving_unchanged_since_ = 0;
436 std::vector<SentPing> pings_since_last_response_;
437 // Transaction ID of the last connectivity check received. Null if having not
438 // received a ping yet.
439 absl::optional<std::string> last_ping_id_received_;
440
441 absl::optional<int> unwritable_timeout_;
442 absl::optional<int> unwritable_min_checks_;
443 absl::optional<int> inactive_timeout_;
444
445 bool reported_;
446 IceCandidatePairState state_;
447 // Time duration to switch from receiving to not receiving.
448 absl::optional<int> receiving_timeout_;
449 int64_t time_created_ms_;
450 int num_pings_sent_ = 0;
451
452 absl::optional<webrtc::IceCandidatePairDescription> log_description_;
453 webrtc::IceEventLog* ice_event_log_ = nullptr;
454
455 // GOOG_PING_REQUEST is sent in place of STUN_BINDING_REQUEST
456 // if configured via field trial, the remote peer supports it (signaled
457 // in STUN_BINDING) and if the last STUN BINDING is identical to the one
458 // that is about to be sent.
459 absl::optional<bool> remote_support_goog_ping_;
460 std::unique_ptr<StunMessage> cached_stun_binding_;
461
462 const IceFieldTrials* field_trials_;
463 rtc::EventBasedExponentialMovingAverage rtt_estimate_;
464
465 friend class Port;
466 friend class ConnectionRequest;
467 friend class P2PTransportChannel;
468};
469
470// ProxyConnection defers all the interesting work to the port.
471class ProxyConnection : public Connection {
472 public:
473 ProxyConnection(Port* port, size_t index, const Candidate& remote_candidate);
474
475 int Send(const void* data,
476 size_t size,
477 const rtc::PacketOptions& options) override;
478 int GetError() override;
479
480 private:
481 int error_ = 0;
482};
483
484} // namespace cricket
485
486#endif // P2P_BASE_CONNECTION_H_
487
